hook_150: As we enter 2025, Iâ€™ve been reflecting on my goals for the year and the lessons Iâ€™ve learned about sustaining energy and focus. I used to work seven d
full_text:
As we enter 2025, Iâ€™ve been reflecting on my goals for the year and the lessons Iâ€™ve learned about sustaining energy and focus. I used to work seven days a week, barely pausing to breathe, thinking it was the only way to succeedâ€”but Iâ€™ve since realized how unsustainable that was. 

Social media is quick to glamorise working all hours and pushing through without taking breaks. In recent conversations with founders, I noticed a common theme: theyâ€™re so focused on achieving their big goals that theyâ€™re leaving nothing in the tank for themselves. One founder told me they worked through every weekend last year, taking just a handful of days off. Another shared how they felt completely stuck after a setback, without tools to navigate the emotional toll.

I could relate. For years, I had no tools either. Iâ€™ve spent the last few years working on that, and now, I feel like I have the tools to help me recharge, reset, and plan effectively. I thought Iâ€™d share a few of the things that helped in case theyâ€™re helpful for you too.

#1: Taking Real Breaks
For years, I didnâ€™t take weekends off. Now, I intentionally carve out time to recharge. Giving myself space to pause has been transformativeâ€”it helps me reset and approach the week ahead with clarity and energy. Contrary to what I originally thought, taking breaks helps me to â€˜work smarter, not harderâ€™.

#2: Setting Walking Goals
A few years ago, I challenged myself to walk 100 km every month. It was a game-changer. Those walks became my thinking time, a chance to brainstorm, reflect, get some exercise and time in nature. This year, Iâ€™m excited to bring that habit backâ€”itâ€™s something Iâ€™ve missed and canâ€™t wait to reintroduce into my routine.

#3: Meditating Every Day
Meditation didnâ€™t come easily to me. Iâ€™d sit there thinking about work instead of relaxing! But over time, Iâ€™ve found it incredibly helpful. I use the Calm app for 10 minutes before bed, which clears my mind and improves my sleep. Itâ€™s also helped transform my inner self-talk, making me kinder to myself.

#4: Experimenting with AI Walks
This year, Iâ€™ve started combining my walks with AI tools. I use AirPods to record my thoughts and then let AI organize those ideas into actionable steps (yes, in Canva!). Itâ€™s been surprisingly effective at turning big-picture brainstorming into tangible progress. Iâ€™m excited to see where it goes this year and to continue to refine it.

#5: Building Simple, Intentional Habits
Small â€˜ritualsâ€™ like journaling for five minutes each morning, spending time in nature or keeping a consistent bed time and wake time (one of my 2025 goals!) can make a huge difference. 

I certainly donâ€™t have it all figured outâ€”Iâ€™m still learning, and these habits are evolving. But Iâ€™ve noticed how much better I feel when I make time for myself, and I wanted to share in case these ideas resonate with you too.

What habits or tools have made a difference in your life? Iâ€™d love to hear whatâ€™s worked for you too! ðŸŒŸ

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: Building Canva has taken the hard work, passion, creativity, and dedication of an incredibly talented group of people. We now have a team of more than 1,500 people around the world helping turn our crazy big goals into reality while striving to bring magic to our community every single day.
hook_150: Building Canva has taken the hard work, passion, creativity, and dedication of an incredibly talented group of people. We now have a team of more than
full_text:
Building Canva has taken the hard work, passion, creativity, and dedication of an incredibly talented group of people. We now have a team of more than 1,500 people around the world helping turn our crazy big goals into reality while striving to bring magic to our community every single day.

Itâ€™s been incredible to see crazy big goals that we have set being turned into reality to be used by millions of people - but thereâ€™s one in particular that really stands out, dating back to the very beginning of Canva when we had the good fortune of meeting David Hearnden and somehow convinced him to join the team as our CTO.

Since that day, Dave has been dreaming about launching simultaneous collaboration in Canva (multiple people designing together in real-time). It was a goal so ambitious that he vowed to forego cutting his hair until we made it possible.

Launching simultaneous collaboration in Canva was an absolutely massive feat â€“ it involved many years of engineering effort and doing many â€˜world firstsâ€™. So when we officially unlocked this milestone, Dave had a ceremonious haircut and we created a little film of the occasion to celebrate internally but thought we'd share it here for a bit of fun!

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: I feel like I just got a new job. A pretty important one, I think.
hook_150: I feel like I just got a new job. A pretty important one, I think.  Iâ€™ve joined the PR team for â€œImagination.â€  You might be wondering, why does imagi
full_text:
I feel like I just got a new job. A pretty important one, I think.

Iâ€™ve joined the PR team for â€œImagination.â€

You might be wondering, why does imagination need a PR team? It's not a company? Well, lately, imagination has had a bit of a PR problem.

â€œItâ€™s just in her imagination.â€
â€œItâ€™s not realistic.â€

Sound familiar? Thatâ€™s exactly the issue. When imagination gets dismissed as naÃ¯ve or unrealistic, we stop taking it seriously, even though itâ€™s the single most powerful force shaping our shared future. One to be taught, honed, valued and refined.

If we donâ€™t imagine the world we want, how can we possibly create it?

A couple of months ago, while preparing for our keynote, we started listing moments when imagination reshaped reality, times when what once seemed absurd became our new reality.

When the world was bound to the ground, the idea of flying was madness.
When nights were lit by candles and oil lamps, the thought of brightening a room with the flick of a switch was pure fantasy.
When sickness was seen as destiny or divine will, the idea of curing it through science was unimaginable.
When half of humanity was voiceless, the idea of women voting was radical.

And yet, someone imagined each of those things first. And then many people worked hard to turn those completely â€œunrealisticâ€ ideas into the reality we now enjoy today. Everything good was once imagined.

It made me wonder: what are the things youâ€™re most grateful for today that were once just imagined? And whatâ€™s the next â€œimpossibleâ€ thing you hope weâ€™ll imagine into reality?

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: Since the very beginning, our mission has been to empower everyone to design - and we really mean everyone! At Canva, we believe everyone should have access to all the ingredients needed to design, and not just for the few who can afford it. This is why we created an easy-to-use design tool, with all the ingredients you need such as free design templates, fonts, illustrations, and photos.
hook_150: Since the very beginning, our mission has been to empower everyone to design - and we really mean everyone! At Canva, we believe everyone should have
full_text:
Since the very beginning, our mission has been to empower everyone to design - and we really mean everyone! At Canva, we believe everyone should have access to all the ingredients needed to design, and not just for the few who can afford it. This is why we created an easy-to-use design tool, with all the ingredients you need such as free design templates, fonts, illustrations, and photos. 

Today marks a significant milestone at Canva. Iâ€™m incredibly excited to announce that free stock photography sites Pexels and Pixabay have joined the Canva family, so that their library of free, diverse and authentic photos will now be available on Canva. Together, weâ€™re connecting our communities, bringing talented photo contributors from all over the world closer to our Canva community of over 15 million designers worldwide, who are on the lookout for fresh, beautiful photography every day.

We've also announced the roll-out of Photos Unlimited, a world-first stock photography subscription model offering â€œall you can consumeâ€ access to a library of an additional tens of millions of premium stock photos. With these two announcements, weâ€™re giving people more choice, more freedom and the power to visually communicate their ideas in the best possible way. The potential is limitless.

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: A few years ago, we shared our 2 Step Plan:
hook_150: A few years ago, we shared our 2 Step Plan:  1. Build one of the worldâ€™s most valuable companies 2. Do the most good we can do  We have a crazy big dr
full_text:
A few years ago, we shared our 2 Step Plan:

1. Build one of the worldâ€™s most valuable companies
2. Do the most good we can do

We have a crazy big dream: that by the end of our lifetimes, everyone on this planet will have their basic human needs met. Itâ€™s terribly sad that this is still considered a crazy big dream, but thanks to the support of our community, the Canva Foundation is committing another $100 million USD to support people living in extreme poverty to take another step towards this.

Since 2021, our partnership with GiveDirectly has provided $50 million in direct cash transfers to more than 85,000 people in Malawi. Families have used this support to send children to school, access healthcare, start small businesses, and invest in livestock and tools that help create long-term security. Each story is different, but all prove a simple truth: when people are trusted to decide what they need most, the impact is extraordinary.

This new $100 million commitment will reach another 185,000 people, helping families transform their lives, while creating ripple effects that strengthen entire communities. It is, without a doubt, the best money we could ever imagine spending.

Weâ€™ve created a short documentary from journalist David Begnaud's visit to Malawi: https://lnkd.in/gpDpkW8h

Weâ€™re still very much on a learning journey, if youâ€™d like to learn alongside us, visit our blog: https://lnkd.in/gn4TTJrg

With over 30% of Canvaâ€™s value dedicated to doing good, every subscription and every design fuels this mission. Thank you for being part of it â¤ï¸

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: Like millions of people around the world, Iâ€™m saddened and appalled by the devastating news continuing to emerge from Ukraine where millions of innocent people have had their lives turned upside down. Everyone, everywhere, should have the right to peace, safety, and freedom.
hook_150: Like millions of people around the world, Iâ€™m saddened and appalled by the devastating news continuing to emerge from Ukraine where millions of innoce
full_text:
Like millions of people around the world, Iâ€™m saddened and appalled by the devastating news continuing to emerge from Ukraine where millions of innocent people have had their lives turned upside down. Everyone, everywhere, should have the right to peace, safety, and freedom. 

We believe that we have an incredibly important responsibility to use our voice and our resources to advocate for peace and to bring awareness to the unimaginable, unlawful and unjust situation.

To assist with immediate relief, the Canva Foundation is committing $1,000,000 to those impacted by this crisis. Weâ€™re also matching donations from our team, dollar-for-dollar, for up to $5,000 per team member.

Weâ€™ve also launched a number of new templates and illustrations which we hope will become a way for people across the globe to amplify the important call for peace while bringing additional awareness to the tragic situation continuing to unfold.

We stand firmly in support of Ukraine, and in support of peace and freedom everywhere.

author: Melanie Perkins

full_text:
Ten years ago, we launched Canva with the belief that design shouldnâ€™t be limited to people with advanced training or expensive software. Since then, weâ€™re incredibly proud to have brought the power of visual communication to more than 150 million people around the world.

A decade into our journey, weâ€™re excited to mark the start of our next chapter with one of our biggest launches ever. Introducing Magic Studio â€“ the best of AI, all in one place and made for skipping the busywork!

Itâ€™s been pretty extraordinary watching our team rally together to bring Magic Studio to life â€“ I feel incredibly lucky to work with such a passionate and creative crew. 

We'd love to know if you have any favorite features?!

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: A couple of years ago we added an Anti-Discrimination Clause into our Terms of Use. Our aim is to outline clear expectations for our Canva community to abide by when using our platform, and we reserve the legal right to stop them from using our services if they donâ€™t comply. Itâ€™s a small step for us, but putting our values in our Terms seems like a good start towards creating a brighter future. We'd love to see other companies do the same - so decisions donâ€™t feel piecemeal, but in line with shaping a world we can all be proud to live in. Feel free to reuse these Terms as your own.

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: We are extraordinarily excited to unveil the Visual Suite 2.0. It's the biggest product launch in Canva's history and brings creativity and productivity together like never before ðŸš€ âœ¨

full_text:
We are extraordinarily excited to unveil the Visual Suite 2.0. It's the biggest product launch in Canva's history and brings creativity and productivity together like never before ðŸš€ âœ¨

You asked, with more than one million wishes pouring in every year, and we listened. Every request, idea, and piece of feedback from our global community has helped shape what weâ€™re launching today. Visual Suite 2.0 is packed with your most-wanted features: combine every format in a single design, turn numbers into powerful visual spreadsheets, create faster than ever with Canva AI, and now, bring your ideas to life with code.

A massive thank you to our community for being on this journey with us and for sharing the millions of wishes that continue to shape the future of design. Visual Suite 2.0 is a celebration of everything weâ€™ve built together, and we canâ€™t wait to see what youâ€™ll create.

Soâ€¦ which wish do you want to try first? If you didn't check out the keynote yet, you might want to (we're releasing to the first 1 million people today!) or explore all the latest launches right here:

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: Yesterday was a pretty special day.
hook_150: Yesterday was a pretty special day.  For the first time, we brought together more than 3,000 of our Canva team from across Australia and New Zealand u
full_text:
Yesterday was a pretty special day.

For the first time, we brought together more than 3,000 of our Canva team from across Australia and New Zealand under one roof where we unveiled the Canva Creative Operating System, our biggest product launch yet. 

It brings together an upgraded visual suite with Email Design, Forms, and Video 2.0; a powerful new Canva AI layer; Canva Grow, Brand System and the all new Affinity! 

We believe weâ€™re entering a new chapter, the Imagination Era, where the best breakthroughs come not from just how much we know, but by what we can imagine and then create together.

At the end of the keynote, I wore a jacket with whatâ€™s now one of my all-time favourite quotes: â€œEverything good was once imagined.â€

Jimmy Knowles imagined that jacket while having a salt floatâ€¦ and then there I was, on stage, wearing what he had imagined.

The week itself was imagined by an incredible crew who brought every detail to life, from the Canva Express train that carried our team to the event, to all of our product launches imagined by so many across Canva, to every detail of the staging, keynote and the week of festivities, even the wishes for new features were imagined by our community around the world.

It capped off the Canva World Tour, where our teams set off around the globe to meet and teach our community in 40 cities, 30 countries, and with 250+ workshops. 

It was imagination made real, over and over again. And captured what we believe to be true: imagination is the most important skill we have.

Thank you to our absolutely incredible team who made all of this possible.

Everything good was once imagined ðŸ’­

Weâ€™re just getting started... explore all the launches here: https://lnkd.in/gf5xsFVH

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: A number of years ago we took the 1% Pledge where we donated 1% of our team's product, time, profits and equity. I'm pleased to say that we've just crossed another pretty huge milestone of donating more than $1 billion worth of annual product value through our Canva for Education and Nonprofit programs!
hook_150: A number of years ago we took the 1% Pledge where we donated 1% of our team's product, time, profits and equity. I'm pleased to say that we've just cr
full_text:
A number of years ago we took the 1% Pledge where we donated 1% of our team's product, time, profits and equity. I'm pleased to say that we've just crossed another pretty huge milestone of donating more than $1 billion worth of annual product value through our Canva for Education and Nonprofit programs!

One of the best parts of our job is seeing the way Canva has been used in the classrooms and nonprofits in every corner of the globe to help achieve their goals. A massive thanks to our incredible team who help empower our community every day, and our incredible community who have helped to spread Canva far and wide and are still our biggest marketing channel, even after all these years.

If you are part of one of these programs we'd love to hear how you use Canva! And if you aren't but know a nonprofit or school not yet using Canva, we'd love to give them a paid account on us at:Â canva.com/educationÂ orÂ canva.com/nonprofits

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: For many years at Canva weâ€™ve had what we call â€œour Two-Step Planâ€: (1) to build one of the worldâ€™s most valuable companies, and (2) to do the most good we can do.
hook_150: For many years at Canva weâ€™ve had what we call â€œour Two-Step Planâ€: (1) to build one of the worldâ€™s most valuable companies, and (2) to do the most go
full_text:
For many years at Canva weâ€™ve had what we call â€œour Two-Step Planâ€: (1) to build one of the worldâ€™s most valuable companies, and (2) to do the most good we can do.

It's only because of the contributions from our incredible team and the support from the millions of people who use Canva that weâ€™ve been able to make progress towards these steps. 

Today, weâ€™re incredibly excited to share an update on Step Two as we embark on the next phase of our partnership with GiveDirectly through a $20M cash transfer program in Malawi as part of our goal to help uplift people from extreme poverty. Hearing the stories and impact from our first program, itâ€™s the best money we could ever imagine spending. 

We have had lots of questions throughout our journey about giving cash directly to people in extreme poverty, and so in the post below we dive into a number of questions weâ€™ve asked and questions asked by our team, we hope you find it as interesting as we did!

full_text:
Five years ago, I published a blog answering some of the frequently asked questions from other founders about our journey building Canva. I called that Part One, and now, five years later, as we celebrate Canva turning 10, it seemed fitting to finally follow up with Part Two!

Perhaps the best metaphor for a startup is a rollercoaster - a mixture of scary and excitement, ups, downs, and everything in between. But never a dull moment! Hopefully, some of our learnings are helpful for others too!

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: Canva has been brought to life by the hard work of so many incredible people Iâ€™ve been fortunate enough to cross paths with. One of those people is Lars Rasmussen, who has had a profound impact on Canva from our earliest days.
hook_150: Canva has been brought to life by the hard work of so many incredible people Iâ€™ve been fortunate enough to cross paths with. One of those people is La
full_text:
Canva has been brought to life by the hard work of so many incredible people Iâ€™ve been fortunate enough to cross paths with. One of those people is Lars Rasmussen, who has had a profound impact on Canva from our earliest days.

Before Canva had a single line of code, before we even had an engineering team, he generously shared his wisdom, helping me understand the extraordinarily strong engineering talent we needed to bring our vision to life. We dreamed about the future together, and his guidance played a pivotal role in helping us to get started.

Beyond Canva, Lars had left an undeniable mark on technology weâ€™ve come to know and love as the co-founder of Google Maps, he helped change how we navigate the world. Now, heâ€™s channeling that same ambition and energy into building a thriving tech scene in Greece. He believes a massive tech festival could help ignite the movement, and I couldnâ€™t agree more!

When he invited me to speak, I couldnâ€™t say no. The only catch? The event is on the other side of the world, and with other commitments, I couldnâ€™t be there in person. But in true Lars fashion, where challenges become opportunities, we decided to push the boundaries and experiment with new technology.

So, Iâ€™ll be there â€“ via hologram! Excited to see how it all comes to life, and to speak to the next generation of founders out there ðŸš€

Today, Canva is in 190 countries, with over 1 billion designs created by our loyal community. None of this would have been possible without a great team. A team that is not only talented, driven and hardworking - but a team that also believes in the Canva mission and embraces our values. Iâ€™m incredibly lucky to be able to work with them every single day. #50BPTW19 #GPTWAU

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: It was fun sharing the long and winding journey of getting Canva off the ground with Guy Raz on 'How I Built This'. It was far from a straight forward journey and often felt like I was running completely against the grain - but I think the challenges along the way made me even more appreciative of the incredible team and community we have today and excited about what we can now build in the future.

As we continue to scale our Engineering team at Canva, we need to ensure that we cultivate and invest in the learning and development of the next generation of engineers. We hosted our first official Intern & Grad program this year and I've been blown away by what they have been able to achieve!

first_line: Excited to announce our first ever Canva UX Masterclass on the 25th November at our creative space in Surry Hills! If you're a product or UX designer, or even just interested in learning about creating better user experiences for all, I'd love to see you there!

full_text:
Excited to announce our first ever Canva UX Masterclass on the 25th November at our creative space in Surry Hills! If you're a product or UX designer, or even just interested in learning about creating better user experiences for all, I'd love to see you there!

Learn new skills and get an inside look at how we approach UX at Canva. I'll be there with Canva CPO Cameron Adams, as well as the UX crew from our mobile, print and editor teams - working together to help solve practical issues affecting nonprofits today. 

For more info, please check out our website below - spaces are limited, so register today!

full_text:
"Over the years thereâ€™s been a positive shift in stock photography, with the ranks of top selling images moving away from the clichÃ©... to a more empowered representation of women in the workplace, climbing mountains - and generally being a little more kick ass."

-- I love this blog written by Elle Hughes from our Marketplace team, highlighting the need for a more diverse and inclusive library of stock photography. We recently launched our Natural Women Collection challenges both societal standards of beauty and gender norms - check out how this collection came to be, and how we made it happen. There's still a long way to go in the media and the world -- but I feel like things are moving in the right direction.

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: Since our earliest days we have 'set crazy big goals' and worked tirelessly to make them happen. We have 500+ people at Canva and our focus on 'crazy big goals' has remained. We set large aspirational goals and then work hard to figure out steps to eventually get there.
hook_150: Since our earliest days we have 'set crazy big goals' and worked tirelessly to make them happen. We have 500+ people at Canva and our focus on 'crazy
full_text:
Since our earliest days we have 'set crazy big goals' and worked tirelessly to make them happen. We have 500+ people at Canva and our focus on 'crazy big goals' has remained. We set large aspirational goals and then work hard to figure out steps to eventually get there.

For example our company's mission is 'to empower the world to design', in 2016 we launched in 20 languages, 2017 we launched in 100 and last year we tackled some of the trickier languages like Chinese and Arabic. While we haven't yet empowered 'the whole world' - the 'crazy big goal' has helped us to take strides in that direction and is now part of everything we do.

In this blog I dive into a little more detail about how we shape our company around goals and hope you find something helpful that you can apply!

author: Melanie Perkins
first_line: Taking on any big goal is always going to be fraught with challenges and feel like a rollercoaster ride. However, for those who feel like they are on the outside (for many different reasons) it's going to be even more challenging. I feel like a lot gets written about what should and shouldn't be done, and deservedly so, but if you happen to be one of those people that feel like you are on the outside - here's some of the things I've learnt along the way. #changethestats

first_line: In a couple of short minutes we can dramatically improve our teams and our performance, by simply asking those around you â€˜how can I improve or make your job easierâ€™. Despite how obvious it is - it's surprising how often we never do it. The question may make us feel vulnerable, the time may never seem right or we simply might not think of it. But asking this very simple question can help us to radically accelerate our learnings and relationships.

full_text:
In a couple of short minutes we can dramatically improve our teams and our performance, by simply asking those around you â€˜how can I improve or make your job easierâ€™. Despite how obvious it is - it's surprising how often we never do it. The question may make us feel vulnerable, the time may never seem right or we simply might not think of it. But asking this very simple question can help us to radically accelerate our learnings and relationships.

In this blog post, our performance coach Sarah Nanclares shares the best way to ask, give and receive feedback. If you have any other tips, please share them below!
